com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing

Interface Trace<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TraceDefault

    public interface Trace<T>
    A trace gathers information from its parent probe, and offers methods to access and save this information.

    When the trace is enabled, it keeps track of value changes on the parent probe.
    However, the trace may not contain all value changes if these have happened in short enough time delay (ie: a delay smaller than getDelay()).
    Also, if the trace contains too much information (more than getMaxLength()) then the trace delay may be increased and some value changes removed.
    Though, in any circumstances, the trace will contain the first value change (when it was enabled) and the last value change.

    If the trace is disabled then no history of the value changes is kept.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        Probe<T> getParent()
        Returns:
        the Probe used by this trace

      • discard

        void discard()
        Disables and discards this trace.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this trace is already discarded

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if this trace is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if this trace is enabled
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean v)
        Enables or disables this trace.

        If the trace is enabled then it will keep track of value changes on the parent probe. These values are then accessible via getValues().

        If the trace is disabled then value changes on the parent probe are ignored and are not included in the list returned by getValues().

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this trace is discarded

      • getMaxLength

        int getMaxLength()
        Returns the maximum trace length.

        Default is DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_LENGTH if not specified otherwise.

        Returns:
        maximum trace length

      • setMaxLength

        void setMaxLength(int length)
        Updates the maximum length of the trace.
        When the trace contains too much information, then the trace delay may be increased.
        Parameters:
        length -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if you give a length smaller than 2

      • getDelay

        long getDelay()
        Returns the minimum time delay before a probe value change is taken into account. In other words, the minumum time delay before a probe value change is included in the list returned by by getValues().

        Default is DEFAULT_DELAY if not specified otherwise.

        Returns:
        the minimum time delay before a probe value change is taken into account

      • setDelay

        void setDelay(long value)
        Updates the minimum time delay before a probe value change is taken into account.

        If the delay is increased, then some trace values may be removed.

        Parameters:
        value -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if you give negative delay

      • getValues

        List<TraceItem<T>> getValues()
        Returns an unmodifiable list containing TraceItems ordered chronologically.

        The returned list will not necessarily contain an item for every possible time, but instead it will contain a new item each time the value of this trace changes.
        Additionally, the minimum time difference between two items in the list is getDelay().

        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list containing TraceItems ordered chronologically
